title.narrative: Final evaluation NBT and IER project with MEDT
Slutlig utvärdering av KK/IER och MEDT- projektet

description.narrative:
The Embassy in Kyiv, Ukraine is to make a call-off from a ranked framework agreement for consulting services to conduct an evaluation of a recently ended project as defined below. The procurement will be made in accordance with the existing framework agreement on agriculture, employment and market development (archive number 14/001220).
In 2015 The Swedish National Board of Trade (NBT) and Institute for Economic Research and Policy Consulting (IER) ended implementation of a join project together with the Ukrainian Ministry of Economic Development and Trade (MEDT). The aim of the project between NBT and MEDT was to strengthen the capacity of the Ministry of Economic Development and Trade within the framework of WTO issus and particularly issues related to Technical Barriers to Trade (TBT). The aim for the IER project was similar, but more focused on increasing collaboration with the business sector and provide analytical input and material for the use of the ministry.
To enable effective future programming and use of lessons learned, the embassy aims to conduct an evaluation primarily focusing on effectiveness in implementation and methods used. The idea is to have a forward looking evaluation.

UM Kiev skall genomföra avrop av konsulttjänster för att genomföra en utvärdering av två nyligen avslutade handelsprojekt där Kommerskollegium (NBT) och Institute for Economic Research and Policy Consulting (IER) var implementerande part och Ministry of Economic Development and Trade (MEDT) var mottagande part. Syftet är att ta lärdomar av det avslutade projektet gällande effektivitet i genomförande inför eventuell kommande programmering. Avropet sker i enlighet med ramavtalet som gäller för marknadsutveckling i enlighet med villkoren i ramavtalet (arkivnr. 14/001220).
Kommerskollegium (NBT) och Institute for Economic Research and Policy Consulting (IER) avslutade den 31 december 2015 ett femårigt handelsprojekt. Syftet för projektet mellan NBT och ekonomiministeriet var att stärka kapaciteten hos det ukrainska ekonomiministeriet inom ramen för WTO-frågor och framför allt med fokus på TBT-frågor (Technical Barriers to Trade). Huvudsaklig mottagare från den ukrainska sidan var Enquiry Point & Noticiation Unit (EP). Syftet med att involvera IER var att stärka kontakterna med näringslivet i genomförandet och att skapa analytiskt material till nytta för ekonomisministeriet.
För att ta tillvara lärdomar från implementeringen av de två projekten ämnar ambassaden göra en utvärdering, med primärt på effektivititet i genomförande och metod. Tanken är en framåtblickade utvärdering med lärdomar för eventuell kommande programmering.

The main objective of the evaluation was to determine the impact and efficiency of the projects “Institutional Cooperation between the Department for WTO and Trade Defence at the Ministry of Economic Development and Trade of Ukraine andSwedish National Board of Trade” and “Trade Policy and Practice in Ukraine”. Specific attention was also to be paid to sustainability, methods for capacity development, and the capacity of MEDT to take on additional trade-related projectswith DCFTA linkages

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: The evaluation clearly advised the Embassy not to continue with further support to the MEDT in the are of trade and that any support to the area must be based on a clear value-add from the Swedish perspective. The evaluators made further very strong statements about the lack of sustainable results that the Embassy was compelled to take very seriously in consideration of future support.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
